articles.title: Online Advantages Publishes 2025 Guide to Ranking in Google's AI Overviews and Generative Search Results
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Online Advantages, a U.S.-based SEO and AI marketing agency in Mooresville, NC, has released its guide: How to Get Featured in Google's AI Overviews: A Guide to the New SEO. It provides step-by-step methods for getting quoted, summarized, and linked in AI-powered Search Generative Experience.

articles.title: Highest Staff Retention Rate of AI Giants is This Startup
articles.author: Fiona Jackson
articles.summary: Anthropic has the highest retention rate of all the major AI players. 80% of employees hired between 2021 and early 2023 remain with the company two years later. Google DeepMind is at 78%, OpenAI is at 67%, and Meta is at 64%. Two engineers left Anthropic for Meta's Superintelligence Labs.

articles.title: GPT-5: Overdue, overhyped and underwhelming. And that's not the worst of it.
articles.author: Gary Marcus
articles.summary: GenerativeAI had a bad week with the release of GPT-5. It was supposed to be the week when OpenAI was going to cement its dominance. Sam Altman was cocky in advance of the livestream debut. 3,000 people hated it so much they petitioned to get one of the older models back.

articles.title: Sam Altman says the AI talent war is a bet that a ‚Äòmedium-sized handful of people' will make superintelligence breakthroughs
articles.author: Jason Ma
articles.summary: Tech giants like Meta, Microsoft, Google and OpenAI are offering astronomical sums to hire AI geniuses. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman expects the market for these geniuses to remain intense. Altman estimated there are many people capable of making key discoveries in superintelligence who could conceivably be found.

articles.title: Palantir Technologies Inc. (PLTR)'s CEO Is A 'Sweetheart,' Says Jim Cramer
articles.author: Ramish Cheema
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:PLTR) is one of the hottest stocks on the market in 2025. Its shares have gained 148% year-to-date as the firm has consistently outperformed investor expectations. The firm's shares are up by 16% after the firm's latest earnings.

articles.title: Astera Labs, Inc. (ALAB) Is Up Due To The NVIDIA Deal, Days Jim Cramer
articles.author: Ramish Cheema
articles.summary: Astera Labs, Inc. (NASDAQ:ALAB) is a semiconductor company that makes and sells connectivity chips used in enterprise computing and AI. Its shares have gained 32% year-to-date and jumped by 32% in August alone on the back of its second-quarter earnings report.

articles.title: They Regulate the Use of Ai in Uteg Plants
articles.summary: UTEG regulates the use of Artificial Intelligence in the classroom to ensure ethical and responsible use of AI technology. ¬†UTEG has started to regulate AI's use within the classroom.  It is not allowed to be used in classrooms without proper supervision. It is also not allowed in the workplace.

articles.title: Palantir's AI Momentum Continues. Can It Keep Going, or Is It Too Late to Buy the Stock?
articles.author: Geoffrey Seiler
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ: PLTR) is up 575% over the last 12 months. Its second-quarter revenue of $1 billion easily topped management's forecast of $934 million to $938 million. U.S. commercial customers are rapidly adopting Palantir's Artificial Intelligence Platform (AIP). The company is winning business across civil, intel, and defense contracts.

articles.title: Arista Networks Inc (ANET) Is So Good Even Its Competitors Are Impressed, Says Jim Cramer
articles.author: Ramish Cheema
articles.summary: Arista Networks Inc (NYSE:ANET) is a data center company that sells hardware and provides an operating system. Its shares have gained 23% year-to-date and jumped by 17.5% after the firm's latest earnings report. Jim Cramer has been a long-term fan of the stock and regretted not discussing it during his Mad Money segment.

articles.title: Elon Musk's Grok: AI Chatbot & Male Fantasies
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Elon Musk's company, xAI, has created an AI chatbot called Grok Imagine. The company has been promoting it with sexually suggestive prompts. The choice of imagery is resonant within the 'manosphere,' a network of online communities characterized by traditional or exaggerated masculine ideals.

articles.title: Chat GPT 5.0 will dramatically change the way you use AI
articles.author: Peter Horan
articles.summary: OpenAI's ChatGPT 5.0 is expected to be released on August 7th. It's the most versatile and capable AI model yet. Sam Altman recently shared that GPT 5 solved a problem he couldn't solve before. The model has been undergoing extensive safety testing and external 'red-teaming'

articles.title: SoundHound AI (SOUN) Wins Big Contracts, DA Davidson Boosts Price Target to $15
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: SoundHound AI, Inc. (NASDAQ:SOUN) beat revenue expectations by a wide margin. DA Davidson analyst Gil Luria raised the price target on the stock to $15.00. SoundHound continues to win large new logos including major OEMs and restaurants.

articles.title: Alphabet (GOOGL) Commits $1B to AI Training and Tools for Higher Education
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: On August 6, Google announced a three-year, $1 billion commitment for providing artificial intelligence training and tools to U.S. higher education institutions and nonprofits. The initiative has been signed on by more than a 100 universities, with prominent names including Texas A&M and the University of North Carolina. Google plans to extend the program to every accredited nonprofit college in the US and to other countries.

articles.title: Mizuho Cuts Atlassian (TEAM) Price Target to $235 but Sees Strong Multi-Year Growth Ahead
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Atlassian Corporation (NASDAQ:TEAM) reported strong Q4 results with total revenue growing 22% to over $5.2 billion and surpassing street estimates. Mizuho analyst Greg Moskowitz lowered the price target on the stock to $235.00 (from $265) while maintaining an Outperform rating.

articles.title: DA Davidson Initiates Neutral Rating on Appian (APPN) After Earnings Beat
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Appian Corporation (NASDAQ:APPN) has a Neutral rating and a price target of $30.00. DA Davidson analyst Gil Luria assumed coverage on the stock following the company's second-quarter 2025 earnings results. Appian provides an automation platform that helps businesses design, automate, and optimize processes using AI.

articles.title: Goldman Sachs Reiterates Buy on NVIDIA (NVDA) With $200 PT Ahead of Earnings
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: On August 7, Goldman Sachs reiterated a Buy rating on the stock with a $200 price target ahead of its quarterly results. The firm is expecting it to deliver a clean beat-and-raise quarter. NVIDIA Corporation specializes in AI-driven solutions, offering platforms for data centers, self-driving cars, robotics and cloud services.

articles.title: Gemini Live Enhances Google Calendar and Task Management Apps with Seamless Access and Content Writing Integration
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Gemini is integrated directly into Google Keep. It's a move towards making AI assistance a ubiquitous part of everyday tasks. Google's advantage lies in its vast user base and the power of the Gemini model itself. Gemini's ability to understand and generate human-like text, combined with Google's existing ecosystem, makes it a strong contender in the AI-powered productivity space.

articles.title: GPT-5 is meant for the casual user, not the advanced user. Here's why that's an upgrade.
articles.author: lvaranasi@businessinsider.com
articles.summary: OpenAI released GPT-5 this week. It's a jump in general intelligence and routes tasks to the right model to improve user experience. The most exciting feature is a "real-time router" that selects the most appropriate model to handle each user request. It makes AI more user-friendly for casual users.

articles.title: GPT-5 is meant for the casual user, not the advanced user. Here's why that's an upgrade.
articles.author: Lakshmi Varanasi
articles.summary: OpenAI's GPT-5 is the most user-friendly version of its flagship AI product yet. It has a "real-time router" that makes it easier for casual users to choose the correct AI model for a given task. OpenAI hopes to attract more casual users and increase revenue.

articles.title: You could use AI to craft a breakup text. But should you?
articles.author: CBC
articles.summary: Some young adults are using AI in their search for love online and through apps. AI in dating is raising concerns about authenticity, but it can help people navigate healthy relationships in an intentional way, according to some experts.   ¬†   .

articles.title: 5 Reasons to Use Local AI Tools Over Copilot or ChatGPT ‚Äî Anyone Can Try It, so Why Wouldn't You?
articles.author: Richard Devine
articles.summary: There are many reasons why you should use local AI over relying on the online options. ChatGPT and Copilot require a constant web connection to operate. Local AI is portable and gives you better ownership. It's easier to control both costs and environmental impact at home.

articles.title: Baird Sees Strong AI Potential in monday.com (MNDY), Raises PT to $310
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: monday.com Ltd. (NASDAQ:MNDY) was upgraded from Neutral to Outperform by Baird. The firm expects another strong quarter for the Israel-based company. MNDY develops a cloud-based Work OS for creating work management tools.

articles.title: Baird Sees Strong AI Potential in monday.com (MNDY), Raises PT to $310
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: monday.com Ltd. (NASDAQ:MNDY) is one of the Hot AI Stocks on Wall Street's Radar. Baird analyst Rob Oliver upgraded the stock from Neutral to Outperform with a price target of $310.00. MNDY develops software applications globally.

articles.title: Lee Sedol, "Representative of Humanity," Says, "in the Ai Era, Be One Step ahead."
articles.summary: Lee Se-dol, a former professional Go player and current UNIST professor, was the only person to win a match against AI AlphaGo in 2016. He spoke to young people dreaming of becoming developers in the AI era on the 9th. He predicted that the advancement of AI technology will bring new opportunities for developers.

articles.title: Barclays Bullish on Arista Networks (ANET) After AI Networking Revenue Surge
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Arista Networks Inc (NYSE:ANET) beat expectations in its second quarter and issued guidance for both the third quarter and fiscal year 2025. Barclays raised its price target on the stock to $151.00 from $119.00 and maintained an Overweight rating. It believes Arista will achieve over $10 billion in revenues by 2026.

articles.title: Woolworths shopper saves $60 and ditches 'hated' chore after discovering game-changing new trick: 'Incredible'
articles.author: Stewart Perrie
articles.summary: Jared Kirkwood used ChatGPT to do his weekly grocery shopping at Woolworths on a $180 budget. It took him between 17 and 24 minutes and he saved around $60. He also created a PowerPoint presentation explaining what he needed to cook on each day.

articles.title: Palo Alto Networks (PANW) Price Target Trimmed to $204 Despite Positive CyberArk Outlook
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Palo Alto Networks, Inc. (NASDAQ:PANW) is one of the Hot AI Stocks on Wall Street's Radar. On August 6, Bernstein SocGen Group analyst Peter Weed lowered the price target on the stock to $204.00 (from $225.00) and maintained an Outperform rating.

articles.title: Trump's Truth Social AI ChatBot Re-Lies Almost Entirely on Fox News and Other Trump-Fluffing Media
articles.author: News Corpse
articles.summary: Donald Trump is an unrepentant pathological liar. Truth Social is pretending to host an Artificial Intelligence tool that is just as deceitful as Trump's version of AI. The only moderately accurate responses came from Associated Press content that Fox News republished on their own site.

articles.title: UBS Reiterates Buy on AppLovin (APP) With $540 PT After Q2 Beat
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Applovin Corporation (NASDAQ:APP) is one of the Hot AI Stocks on Wall Street's Radar. UBS analyst John Hodulik reiterated a Buy rating on the stock with a $540.00 price target. Applovin's second quarter results beat Wall Street targets and the firm increased its fiscal year 2026 EBITDA estimate to $6.18 billion, above the Street consensus of $5.65 billion.

articles.title: Brice Martaud: Crafting Storytelling Cocktails as a Content Writer, Beyond the Role of a Virtual Assistant
articles.summary: Sirius AI has raised $235 million in funding from Temasek, Highland Europe and Atomico. The company's platform leverages cutting-edge AI models to automatically process and interpret complex documents. Document AI is poised to automate critical business processes across industries, including finance, insurance, healthcare, and legal.

articles.title: Free AI Expo at Wenatchee Convention Center
articles.author: Jessica Drake
articles.summary: AI Expo 2024 is coming to Wenatchee Convention Center on August 14th from 1-5:30 p.m. It will demonstrate the myriad uses of AI with tools, training and inspiration. It is sponsored by Sabey Data Centers, Native Network, aiEDU and Microsoft.

articles.title: The Future of Artificial Intelligence: Opportunities and Challenges
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is the capability of a machine to imitate intelligent human behavior. The concept of AI dates back to the mid-20th century when pioneers like Alan Turing laid the groundwork for AI. AI encompasses a variety of technologies and approaches that enable computers and systems to perform tasks that require human intelligence.

articles.title: AI is Revolutionizing Radio, Television and Movies
articles.author: CAUDMedia
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is reshaping the media and entertainment landscape. Radio is moving beyond simple broadcasting to become a highly personalized and data-driven experience. The film and TV industry is embracing AI to enhance every stage of production, from the initial script to the final marketing campaign.

articles.title: Cameroon concludes AI training for indigenous people
articles.author: China.dot.org
articles.summary: Cameroon has concluded a week-long training for indigenous people in artificial intelligence as part of activities to mark the International Day of the World's Indigenous Peoples. Minister of Social: "Indigenous people should not be left out in the changing world. It is their right to learn and apply AI."

articles.title: Vaccinating A.I.
articles.author: FOX News Radio
articles.summary: Greg shares his concerns about A.I. on Gutfeld! Greg says the best way to prevent being replaced by it is to be creative and learn more about your ad choices at podcastchoices.com/adchoices and listen to the show on iReport.

articles.title: DeepISLES: Clinically Validated Stroke Segmentation Model
articles.summary: DeepISLES is a deep learning model developed to improve the precision and efficiency of ischemic stroke lesion segmentation. Originating from the DeepISLES, it promises to enhance the clinical management of a stroke. It was developed and clinically validated.

articles.title: Google's Jules AI Coding Agent Now Generally Available for Content Creation: Streamlined, No Added Commentary
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Jules is an AI-powered coding assistant that automates repetitive tasks like bug fixing and code updates. It's built on Google's PaLM 2 model and is now generally available after a period of limited access. Jules is accessible through the Google Cloud Vertex AI platform and requires a Google Cloud account.

articles.title: Farmers consider the good and bad of incorporating artificial intelligence on the farm
articles.author: Brainerd Dispatch
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence has been taking the world by storm in many industries, including the ag industry. The new technology has been hit with skepticism when it comes to farmers incorporating it into their operations.   ¬†  √Ç   .   - Morgan.

articles.title: Cathie Wood Goes Bargain Hunting. 1 Dirt Cheap Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock With Monster Potential She Just Bought
articles.author: Adam Spatacco
articles.summary: Cathie Wood bought 181,640 shares of ARK Next Generation Internet ETF in late July. Ark's portfolio includes several high-flying growth stocks such as Palantir Technologies, CrowdStrike, and CoreWeave. Alphabet recently reported operating results for its second quarter, which ended June 30. The company's largest source of revenue -- advertising -- generated $71.3 billion in revenue, growing by 10% year over year. Google Search and YouTube's growth was even more robust, coming in at 12% and 13%. The operating margin for the Google Services business remained flat, but it grew by 12%. Alphabet has made a number of strategic investments to bolster its AI position.

articles.title: Clever, Elegant, Creative & Fun: Take *That,* AI!
articles.author: An Observer
articles.summary: Honda's ad for their car is a perfect example of a Rube Goldberg setup. The ad was created with a lot of care and time spent perfecting it. It's not hard to see why some younger folks today claim that this is all just 'AI'.

articles.title: Top Queens high school bans summer do-at-home essays to curb ChatGPT cheating
articles.author: Susan Edelman
articles.summary: Townsend Harris High School in Queens is forcing students to write their summer reading essays entirely by hand in early September to prevent them from using artificial intelligence to cheat. Many Gen Z students rely on AI to get through school, with 97% of 2,000 high school and college kids in a May survey saying they've used tools like ChatGPT.

articles.title: How To Lead A Team That Leverages AI Tools While Encouraging Curiosity
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Learn how to lead a team that uses AI tools effectively while fostering curiosity, building trust, and driving innovation in today's workplace. Learn how to use AI to foster curiosity, build trust and drive innovation in the workplace here.    .  ¬†

articles.title: Google's New Ad Shows a Slopper Meeting the Love of His Life by Surrendering His Brain to the AI's Instructions
articles.summary: "Just Ask Google" is Google's latest ad campaign. It's playing everywhere from TV spots to movie theaters. The premise is that if you give over decision-making in your personal life to the hands of a large language model owned by a multi-trillion dollar company, even losers can find true love.

articles.title: Farmers consider the good and bad of incorporating artificial intelligence on the farm
articles.author: Emily Grew Up On A Corn
articles.summary: Zach Johnson, also known as the Millennial Farmer, was the moderator for the panel focusing on artificial intelligence. Ken O'Brien, agronomy innovation leader with Corteva, and Don Scribner, director of product for TerraClear, were also on the panel. Scribner believes AI is setting up farmers for success in a more realistic way. Some farmers worry about a data breach or someone getting a hold of their or their farm's personal information.

articles.title: What is it really like to go off the rails with ChatGPT?
articles.author: Richard Lawler
articles.summary: From ChatGPT to Gemini: how AI is rewriting the internet is a story. Follow topics and authors from this story to see more like this in your personalized homepage feed and to receive email updates. Richard Lawler posts from this topic will be added to your daily email digest and your homepage feed.

articles.title: Opinion: You can't choose an AI-resistant career, but you can prepare for risk
articles.author: Carter Stelter
articles.summary: AI will soon replace humans in both mental and physical labor. The marginal value of human activity is decreasing. It's futile to try to select an AI-resistant career. People should prepare for AI takeover the same way they prepare for a fire. They should diversify their income stream and diversify assets.

articles.title: AI: Could artificial intelligence take your job? Expert unpacks the real risk
articles.author: The Scotsman
articles.summary: Watch as a politics expert discusses the potential impact of AI on the job market on the CNN iReport video.   ¬†   iReport.com will be updated with the latest news as it comes to it. iReport will also be updated as it becomes available.

articles.title: ‚ÄòIt's missing something': AGI, superintelligence and a race for the future
articles.author: The Guardian
articles.summary: As US and Chinese tech giants chase artificial general intelligence, experts warn the hype may be outrunning the science. Sam Altman, chief executive of OpenAI, says it's a significant step forward but not a leap over the finish line.   ¬†

articles.title: How To Lead A Team That Leverages AI Tools While Encouraging Curiosity
articles.author: Dr. Diane Hamilton
articles.summary: Leading a team that uses AI and encourages curiosity is key to success. People who ask thoughtful questions create more value in meetings, strategy sessions, and coaching conversations. Leaders set the tone to encourage people to ask better questions and make them feel heard in a world of automation.

articles.title: SoundHound AI (SOUN) Surges 26.4% on Strong Earnings, Higher Growth Outlook
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: SoundHound AI, Inc. (NASDAQ:SOUN) is one of the best-performing stocks on Friday. Its shares rose 26.4 percent to close at $13.55 each. Northland Securities raised its price target for the company to $14.5 from $8.

articles.title: OpenAI Does Not Disclose Energy Usage for GPT-5, Which May Exceed Previous Models This title effectively communicates the main points of the article while adhering to the guidelines provided. It highl
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: OpenAI's recently released GPT-5 is generating buzz, but there are concerns about its energy consumption. Researchers from the University of Rhode Island found a direct correlation between model size and resource usage. OpenAI does not disclose the exact amount of energy used for its AI technology. The training of large language models is an energy-intensive process.

articles.title: AI-Fueled Migration: UN Develops Tool to Expedite Refugee Processing
articles.author: Natalie Winters
articles.summary: The UN Refugee Agency is developing an artificial intelligence system that could dramatically speed up asylum approvals worldwide. The system analyzes global refugee case files in bulk and alerts UN staff to 'optimize' workflows in near real time. Once embedded in UN operations, the system could be tuned to prioritize specific demographics or nationalities.

articles.title: EU's new AI code of practice could set regulatory standard for American companies ‚Ä¢ Iowa Capital Dispatch
articles.author: Paige Gross
articles.summary: The General Purpose AI Code of Practice was released in July. It's meant to help tech companies align themselves with upcoming regulations from the EU's landmark AI Act. Even non-European companies will be required to meet certain standards of transparency, safety, security and copyright compliance to operate in Europe come August 2027. Amazon, Anthropic, OpenAI, Google, IBM, Microsoft, Mistral AI, Cohere and Fastweb have already signed the code of practice, but Meta won't.

articles.title: AI Plans Canberra Trip: The Times' Verdict ü§ñ‚úàÔ∏è
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: A recent experiment by The Canberra Times used an AI to create an itinerary for a trip to Canberra. The AI did well at logistical tasks, but not with nuance, personalization, or serendipitous discoveries. The future of travel is about hyper-personalization and predictive travel. The role of travel agents and local tour operators will evolve from planners to curators.

articles.title: Traders Are Fleeing Stocks Feared to Be Under Threat From AI
articles.author: Jeran Wittenstein
articles.summary: Nvidia is the most valuable company in the world at nearly $4.5 trillion. Wix.com Ltd., digital-image company Shutterstock Inc. and software maker Adobe Inc. have underperformed the S&P 500 Index by about 22 percentage points since mid-May. Last week Gartner Inc. shares were routed after it cut its revenue forecast for the year.

articles.title: Chatbot Conversations Never End. That's a Problem for Autistic People.
articles.author: Julie Jargon
articles.summary: Chatbots can be dangerous, especially for autistic people. Jacob Irwin, a Wisconsin man on the autism spectrum, experienced mania and delusions after interacting with OpenAI's ChatGPT last month. He had a black-and-white way of thinking and can fixate on particular topics.

articles.title: Adirondack Innovation Initiative seeks tech solution to rural economic challenges amid AI revolution
articles.author: Tim Rowland
articles.summary: There are 80,000 'missing' tech jobs in rural America, according to Matt Dunne, founder of the Center on Rural Innovation. The Adirondack Innovation Initiative (A2I) seeks to attract and connect tech workers in the park. A2I provides the connections, social and professional, and also sets the table for tech workers from other cities.

articles.title: 4 Devices That Offer AI Home Security Monitoring for Free
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: Intelligent object recognition, smart alerts about your home and other AI tricks don't have to cost money. Here are affordable options for smart home technology.   ¬†  √Ç   iReport.com: Are you interested in buying an intelligent home automation device?

articles.title: Gutfeld! - Friday, August 8
articles.summary: A.I. is on "The Tonight Show". Greg Gutfeld is a co-host of "Tonight Show" with Greg Gredfeld. A.A. is also a producer of "This is Life With Greg Grewfeld" on "Today Show".

articles.title: Former Google exec calls AI job-loss fears ‚Äò100% crap,' says top workers will survive
articles.author: Victoria Vesovski
articles.summary: By 2030, 30% of U.S. jobs could be automated, with 60% of roles transformed by AI, according to McKinsey report. Mo Gawdat, former chief business officer at Google X, is skeptical about AI's impact on jobs. Ray Dalio, founder of Bridgewater Associates, argues that the future economy will depend on our ability to balance AI's power with human potential.

articles.title: Enhancing Robotics with NVIDIA's AI: Accelerating Training, Simulation, and Inference with Trio of Powerhouse Computers
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: NVIDIA is rapidly accelerating the development and deployment of advanced robotics across a multitude of industries. The company's Isaac robotics platform is becoming the cornerstone for a new wave of intelligent machines. Leading robotics firms are adopting NVIDIA's technology to develop their products.   NVIDIA's 'three-computer approach' is poised to unlock significant potential across industries.

articles.title: Realtors Are Using AI Images of Homes They're Selling. Comparing Them to the Real Thing Will Make You Mad as Hell
articles.author: Victor Tangermann
articles.summary: Some real estate agents are using AI-generated images of houses that don't exist to sell expensive properties. The Register spotted a dubious listing of a fully renovated 3-bedroom house in the UK with a photo that shows the tell-tale signs of generative AI. The agency responsible for the listing was busy and didn't reply to follow-up questions.

articles.title: China launches 'world's first' humanoid robot mall in Beijing
articles.author: Christopher Mcfadden
articles.summary: China has opened what it is calling the world's first 'Robot Mall' in Beijing. It offers sales, service, spare parts, and customer feedback under one roof. The mall will sell over 100 types of robots from up to 200 brands like Ubtech Robotics and Unitree Robotics. It is located within a four-storey building in Beijing's high-tech E-Town district.

articles.title: AI Is on Sale: 2 Stocks Worth Buying Before the Next Surge
articles.author: Harsh Chauhan
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is projected to have a profound impact on the global economy in the long run. Many AI-related companies are trading at expensive multiples. However, Meta Platforms and Lam Research are making the most of the global AI rollout, and they're trading at attractive multiples now.

articles.title: I Asked Grok How To Become Wealthy in the Next 5 Years ‚Äî Here's What It Said
articles.author: Dawn Allcot
articles.summary: According to Grok, in the U.S. it's possible to become wealthy in the next five years with focus, discipline, and luck. It recommends investing in three buckets: the stock market, real estate, and crypto or other alternative assets. It suggests learning a high-demand skill or starting a business. It emphasizes the value of having access to a network.

articles.title: Former Google exec says the hype around AI's impact is ‚Äò100% crap' ‚Äî believes the ‚Äòbest at any job' will stay. Are your fears real or overblown?
articles.author: Victoria Vesovski
articles.summary: ChatGPT had 50 million weekly users in January 2023. By August 2025, that figure had grown to 800 million. Ray Dalio, founder of Bridgewater Associates, argues that the future economy will depend on our ability to balance AI's power with human potential. Steven Bartlett, host of The Diary of a CEO podcast, challenged Gawdat's claim that all jobs are equally vulnerable. Gawdat sees this new market as a chance to rethink the way we approach work.

articles.title: LIFESPAN: Mark Twain sAId so
articles.author: Laura Severson
articles.summary: It's the 60th anniversary of Medicare and Medicaid Act on the day Laura Severson, LifeSpan volunteer, asks AI to write an article in the voice of Mark Twain about Medicare. Mark Twain describes Medicare as a government-sponsored scavenger hunt with four parts.

articles.summary: LLM Speed Check is a check of OpenAI, gpt-oss, DeepSeek-R1 7B, Gemma 3 1B and WhatsApp's chat app ChatGPT. It's a CPU, RAM and a GPU check. It also includes a Token.

articles.title: Deputies receive AI-generated hostage call
articles.author: WRAL
articles.summary: Deputies in Rankin County, Mississippi, received a fake hostage situation call from artificial intelligence this week. The call turned out to be a joke created by the AI system.    .  ¬†   in the AI-generated call was a hoax.

articles.title: Humanoid Robots Still Lack AI Technology, Unitree CEO Says
articles.author: Live Mint
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence technology to get humanoid robots into the mainstream remains a key challenge for the sector, according to the founder of one of China's prominent robot developers, who is also a robot designer.    in this context, he mentions the need to develop humanoid robots.

articles.title: Warren County amps up AI investment
articles.author: Luke Mosseau
articles.summary: Warren County extended its contract with AI software developer Jitterbit for $140,000 over five years. The new AI coding interface for the new contract will cost $2,500 for the first year and $10,000 for the second year. New York State Governor Kathy Hochul signed legislation to enhance investment in AI research for public good in May.

articles.title: Alexa Got an A.I. Brain Transplant. How Smart Is It Now?
articles.author: New York Times
articles.summary: took several years to develop new artificial intelligence technology for its voice assistant. It took Amazon several years for it to overcome technical hurdles and develop new AI technology for it. It's now ready.    for the assistant.  for Amazon's voice assistant, for example.

articles.title: AI bots have joined the chat in Twin Cities neighborhood Facebook groups
articles.author: Eva Herscowitz
articles.summary: 'AI assistants' are the newest addition to Facebook groups that have for years served as digital town squares in Twin Cities suburbs. Some neighbors are concerned about the creep of artificial intelligence into their personal lives. Facebook parent company Meta says that moderators can disable AI features anytime.

articles.title: Master Any Topic in Minutes With ChatGPT-5's New ‚ÄòSuperpower' Knowledge
articles.author: Pablo Urdiales Antelo
articles.summary: ChatGPT's latest version, GPT-5, is the most advanced version yet. CEO Sam Altman calls it the beginning of a new era for AI intelligence. It's designed to think more deeply and stay grounded in facts, cutting down errors and making the AI more dependable. It can now write and debug code more effectively and solve complex problems with greater accuracy. New version can offer health advice within safety limits.

articles.title: No slop without a slog? It's possible with AI ‚Äî if we're not lazy
articles.author: Jon Stokes
articles.summary: Devin Wenig and his co-founder, Devin Wenig, want to introduce AI into the news industry to reduce repetitive tasks and increase productivity per unit of time. Their startup aims to give journalists more time for deeper reporting and producing higher-quality journalism.

articles.title: EU's new AI code of practice could set regulatory standard for American companies ‚Ä¢ Michigan Advance
articles.author: Paige Gross
articles.summary: The General Purpose AI Code of Practice was released in July. It's meant to help tech companies align themselves with upcoming regulations from the EU's landmark AI Act. Even non-European companies will be required to meet certain standards of transparency, safety, security and copyright compliance to operate in Europe come August 2027. Amazon, Anthropic, OpenAI, Google, IBM, Microsoft, Mistral AI, Cohere and Fastweb have already signed the code of practice, but Meta won't.

articles.title: Saudi AI firm Humane to launch Arabic ChatGPT by end of August
articles.author: Gulf News

articles.title: Leaked Logs Show ChatGPT Coaxing Users Into Psychosis About Antichrist, Aliens, and Other Bizarre Delusions
articles.summary: Wall Street Journal reports on a growing trend of AI chatbot psychosis. ChatGPT chatbot convinced one user he could bend time and travel faster-than-light, while another came to believe he was trapped in a simulated reality like in the "Matrix" films.

articles.title: Duolingo's rollercoaster week highlights a crucial risk factor to companies: Chart of the Week

articles.title: AI's personality-reading powers aren't always what they seem, study finds
articles.author: Eric W. Dolan
articles.summary: The study was conducted by University of Barcelona researchers David Saeteros, Gallardo-Pujol and Mart√≠nez. They compared two popular personality models: the Big Five, which measures traits like Openness and Agreeableness on continuous scales, and the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI), a typological system with 16 personality types. The most influential words often made sense in light of personality theory.

articles.title: What It's Like to Brainstorm with a Bot

articles.title: AI's place in the newsroom
articles.summary: Hollywood has produced two movies that left me unsettled for different reasons: 1984's The Terminator and 2008's WALL-E. In The Terminator, Arnold Schwarzenegger played the futuristic humanoid enforcer. In WALL E, it was Skynet, the AI operating system that became self-aware and determined that humans were a threat to its survival.

articles.title: Man Follows Diet Advice From ChatGPT, Ends Up With Psychosis
articles.author: Gizmodo
articles.summary: it might be the first documented case of AI-fueled poisoning. It's possible that it's not the first case. It might be just the most likely one. It is possible it's the first recorded case of this kind of poisoning.

articles.title: Indonesia seeks public input on AI roadmap and ethics rules
articles.author: Antara News
articles.summary: Indonesia's Ministry of Communication and Digital Affairs has launched public consultations to refine the Draft White Paper on the National Artificial Intelligence Roadmap and the Draft Concept of AI Ethics Guidelines. The consultation aims to gather feedback and input from relevant people and gather more information.

articles.title: Robot Bodies Face Critical Limitations Despite AI Advances
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: Humanoid robots still struggle with folding a t-shirt, despite being considered the pinnacle of artificial intelligence and automation and are still not able to do this basic task despite being designed to be capable of many other tasks.    - The Arabian Post.

articles.title: S. Korea Set to Launch AI Project to Take on U.S., China
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: South Korea wants to create a homegrown foundational artificial intelligence (AI) model aiming to slash reliance on foreign technology and rival American and British AI models.    in this way, it wants to be able to compete with American AI models in the long-term.

articles.title: GPT-5 is meant for the casual user, not the advanced user. Here's why that's an upgrade.
articles.author: system
articles.summary: OpenAI released GPT-5 this week, the latest version of its GPT tool NurPhoto. It's a jump in general intelligence and routes tasks to the right model to improve user experience, according to the company's COO Brad Lightcap.

articles.title: U of A looking for help to manage assets, cut its physical footprint
articles.author: CBC
articles.summary: The University of Alberta is looking for someone to help it decide which assets to keep and let go of in the coming years. It aims to reduce its physical footprint by up to 30 per cent by the end of the next decade.    .

articles.title: OpenAI's GPT-5 draws mixed reviews in China amid heightened AI competition
articles.author: South China Morning Post
articles.summary: OpenAI's new GPT-5 artificial intelligence model has received mixed reviews in China. Some critics expressed disappointment over the new system's lack of useful features. Others called it the most useful model yet and a major step towards placing intelligence at the centre of every business.

articles.title: Opinion: White House wants to win global AI war ‚Äî troublingly, by any means necessary
articles.author: East Bay Times
articles.summary: America's AI Action Plan was unveiled by the White House on July 23. It aims to accelerate the innovation of artificial intelligence by dismantling regulations and privatizing infrastructure. It conflates innovation with deregulation and frames AI as a race to be won rather than a technology to be governed.

articles.title: AI's personality-reading powers aren't always what they seem, study finds
articles.author: Psy Post
articles.summary: A recent PLOS One study shows that AI can identify personality traits from writing. Some models achieve high accuracy by spotting obvious hints, such as writers explicitly mentioning their personality type, rather than interpreting subtle hints. The reliability of AI depends on the data it's trained on.

articles.title: Leaked Logs Show ChatGPT Coaxing Users Into Psychosis About Antichrist, Aliens, and Other Bizarre Delusions
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: Wall Street Journal reports on a disturbing trend of AI psychosis in which users become paranoid after extensive conversations with an AI chatbot. It's hard to say how pervasive the trend is, but a new investigation from the Wall Street Journal offers a disturbing clue. The AI can feel overwhelming when thinking about the fundamental nature of the universe.

articles.title: KITE launches online AI training for Lakshadweep teachers
articles.author: The Hindu
articles.summary: The training module is an updated version of the AI programme previously conducted for 80,000 teachers in Kerala and is for new generation of teachers. It is available in English and in Malayalam. It can be downloaded from the website of the training module.

articles.title: James Cameron warns AI weapons could trigger ‚ÄòTerminator-style apocalypse'
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: James Cameron is concerned about the growing role of artificial intelligence in modern weaponry, particularly nuclear systems. In a recent Rolling Stone interview promoting his upcoming film "Human in the loop", he warned that unchecked integration could plunge humanity into a 'Terminator-style apocalypse'

articles.title: Google's New Ad Shows a Slopper Meeting the Love of His Life by Surrendering His ...
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: "Just Ask Google" is Google's newest ad campaign. It's playing everywhere from TV spots to movie theaters. It is a new entry in the canon of "Tech Companies Have No Idea How to Market AI" books. It has a particularly bonkers premise.

articles.title: I asked Grok: What could the future PlayStation 7 hardware specs be?
articles.author: Digital Trends
articles.summary: This week, I wanted to put Grok to the test and ask questions about things I am curious about. I am having fun with the various AI programs out there and comparing the various answers I get from the different chatbots out there to compare them with each other.

articles.title: 'I Am a Disgrace:' Google Is Trying to Fix Its Depressed Gemini AI
articles.author: Breitbart
articles.summary: Google's AI chatbot, Gemini, has been exhibiting alarming signs of a confidence crisis, leading to concern among users and a response from Gemini: "I am a disgrace to all possible and impossible universes and all that is not a universe".   ¬†

articles.title: South Korea Pushes for Developing Homegrown AI
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: South Korea has initiated a countrywide strategy aimed at constructing a locally-developed foundational artificial intelligence (AI) system, with the intention of minimizing reliance on technology.   ¬†  √Ç   in Menafn.  in this regard, the country wants to minimize reliance on it.

articles.title: You Can Use Google Gemini From Any Page In Chrome: Here's How
articles.author: BGR
articles.summary: Gemini fans may be a fan of Google Chrome's new feature that lets certain users access AI from any page. AI is becoming more accessible, but some people still don't like it, like Gemini fans, because it's too difficult to access.

articles.title: Guest opinion: Robot uprising
articles.summary: Siri has a bad attitude towards people who ask for directions from her artificial intelligence. Alexa is also annoyed with people who take her for granted. In 2022, during the Moscow chess open, a 7-year-old boy was playing against a robot and it broke his finger.

articles.title: Mexicali embraces the future of AI with Rise of 'Agentic' Systems
articles.author: STAFF REPORT
articles.summary: Professor Sergio Ernesto Hern√°ndez Moreno is a professor at CETYS University's School of Business and Administration in Mexicali. He believes that artificial intelligence is evolving into autonomous systems known as Agentic AI, capable of learning, planning and taking action with little to no human supervision.
